content.body: Is there a room for bikeshed questions? I'm hitting linking errors in my setup and others don't and I'd love some help debugging it..
Noam Rosenthal: note that moving in and out of a disconnected node now works, right? So the DocumentFragment example seems wrong.

content.body: I mean we can fallback to insertion for disconnected->connected / connected->disconnected, but that would not be the "move steps", it would be "falling back to `insertBefore`" which is exactly what they're asking
content.formatted_body: I mean we can fallback to insertion for disconnected->connected / connected->disconnected, but that would not be the "move steps", it would be "falling back to insertBefore" which is exactly what they're asking

content.body: Right. I guess we might never be able to support disconnected <> connected. But we might be able to support connected/disconnected <> other document connected/disconnected.

> <@annevk:matrix.org> Right. I guess we might never be able to support disconnected <> connected. But we might be able to support connected/disconnected <> other document connected/disconnected.

Right, in the future perhaps we'll be able to move cross-origin iframes across documents without reloading them, that would be neat
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
Right. I guess we might never be able to support disconnected <> connected. But we might be able to support connected/disconnected <> other document connected/disconnected.
Right, in the future perhaps we'll be able to move cross-origin iframes across documents without reloading them, that would be neat

content.body: annevk: but this shouldn't preclude us from also having a `moveOrInsertBefore` version and/or something like a `canMove` function, don't you think?
content.formatted_body: annevk: but this shouldn't preclude us from also having a moveOrInsertBefore version and/or something like a canMove function, don't you think?

content.body: I'm not really convinced by the people in that thread thus far. There's a lot of hyperbole and very little concrete arguments.

annevk:  I guess we can also fall back to insert when it's something that inherently doesn't have state, like comment nodes or processing instructions etc, then throwing would be just for disconnected<->connected and across documents
content.formatted_body: annevk: I guess we can also fall back to insert when it's something that inherently doesn't have state, like comment nodes or processing instructions etc, then throwing would be just for disconnected<->connected and across documents
